Articles.Content: When I am transferring fuel from one tank to another, I always mess up because you have to transfer oxidizer and liquid fuel separately. Could you make it so that you can transfer liquid fuel and oxidizer at the same time? Thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

You can use fuel lines for that.

Sometimes you just want to transfer one resource, so you need separate buttons.

> 
> You can use fuel lines for that.

Are you saying you can use fuel lines to manually transfer LFO in a fixed ratio? Because that is what OP is looking for.

I'd actually love to see a replacement for fuel lines; we can manually transfer fuel between tanks, even when they don't have fuel lines attached, and even when they don't have line of sight, so why not use the same system for fuel lines?

I'd much prefer to see fuel transfer blocked completely by a KSC building upgrade, then once unlocked you can both manually transfer fuel, and link up fuel tanks for automatic transfer in the vehicle assembly building. Bam, automatic fuel transfer, just like fuel lines, without line of sight restriction, and without messy fuel lines all over the place.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T20:40:25Z" title="05/11/2015 08:40  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by Rohaq**

Yes, but there should also be an option to transfer both at the same time, just so I don't screw up on accident. And there should also be an option to fill your oxidizer to the level that your liquid fuel is at, so that way you can switch from atomic engines to something else without screwing up.
Yeah, This needs to happen. I'm not sure how this hasn't been fixed yet but it would be very nice if it was.

Such a good idea. An alternative way to achieve the goal is to allow oxidiser to be transferred to "match LF level". There is no use for oxidiser without a stoichiometrically matching quantity of liquid fuel.
